['**On tap** - Literally available for use whenever needed, as water on a tap or beer at a bar.', '**Abundant** - Existing in large quantities; plentiful.', '**Easily obtainable** - Not difficult to acquire or achieve.', '**Accessible** - Easy to approach, reach, or use; readily available.', '**Obtainable on demand** - Something that can be provided as soon as it is requested.', '**At-hand** - Available immediately; within easy reach.', '**Handy** - Conveniently situated for immediate use.', '**Quickly available** - Capable of being accessed or obtained with little delay.', '**Immediate** - Occurring without any intervening time; prompt.', '**Instantly obtainable** - Able to be acquired instantly, with no wait required.', '**Convenient** - Suiting the needs and comfort of a person; conveniently available.', '**Readily accessible** - Easily reached or obtained without difficulty.', '**Within reach** - Close enough to touch or grasp readily.', "**Available at short notice** - Capable of being provided on very little time's warning.", '**Up-to-the-minute** - Having the most current information or products available right now.', '**Promptly available** - Ready for immediate action or use.', '**Quick-fetching** - Capable of being quickly retrieved or obtained.', '**Straightforward to obtain** - Easy and uncomplicated in terms of accessibility.', '**Directly obtainable** - Able to be acquired without intermediaries; straightforward availability.', '**Instantaneously accessible** - Immediate or immediate use; available at the very moment it is needed.']
